paper_abstract: The size-Ramsey number (r) over cap (F) of a graph F is the smallest integer m such that there exists a graph G on m edges with the property that every colouring of the edges of G with two colours yields a monochromatic copy of F. In 1983, Beck provided a beautiful argument that shows that (r) over cap (P-n) is linear, solving a problem of Erdos. In this note, we provide another proof of this fact that actually gives a better bound, namely, (r) over cap (P-n) < 137n for n sufficiently large.
paper_title: An Alternative Proof of the Linearity of the Size-Ramsey Number of Paths
